did.unittitle: Finns in America: Printed Materials Related to the Finnish in America and Their Temperance, Religious, Educational, Labor, and Other Activities. circa 1914-1977
did.abstract: Finns in America is an artificial collection assembled to bring together a variety of miscellaneous printed material related to the Finnish experience in the United States.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The Finns in America collection was assembled from items donated individually or as part of other collections.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright may be held by the respective authors or publishers of the individual publications.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Finns in America, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Finns in America is an artificial collection assembled to bring together a variety of miscellaneous printed material related to the Finnish experience in the United States.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by subject categories and thereunder by author/title.

scopecontent.p: Finns in America includes a variety of literary and historical works including songbooks, almanacs, novels, political tracts, emigration manuals, dictionaries, exhibit catalogs and religious publications.

odd.p: (poetry dealing with the Manifesto the Russians gave to Finland in 1899. The purpose of the Manifesto was to bind the Finns tighter to the Russian empire than before.)
